edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Shop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Shop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class keeps track of the upgrades that the player has bought and how much money the player has. Money can be obtained through Achievements and upgrades are directly used in the GameEngine to be sent as parameters to the Map.
    Author:
    Natanael Ariawan, David Hau, Miguel Menjivar, Aidan Novobilski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Shop.upgrades
      This enumeration represents the four different types of possible items that can be bought in the shop.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean godMode
      This field represents whether or not the player has obtained God mode or not.

      This field represents the player's current health level.

      This field represents how much the magazine upgrade currently costs.

      This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.

      This field represents how much the vision upgrade currently costs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shop()
      This constructor method sets the player's money to 0, each upgrade to level 1, each upgrade cost to 100, and godMode to false.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMoney(int money)
      This method adds money based on the achievement that's been obtained.
      void buyGodMode()
      This method "buys" God mode, which sets godMode to true and decreases the player's money by 4000.
      void buyHealth()
      This method "buys" one health upgrade, which increases the health upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current healthCost, and changes the healthCost accordingly.
      void buyMagazine()
      This method "buys" one magazine upgrade, which increases the magazine upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current magazineCost, and changes the magazineCost accordingly.
      void buyVision()
      This method "buys" one vision upgrade, which increases the vision upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current visionCost, and changes the visionCost accordingly.
      boolean getGodMode()
      This method retrieves the boolean value of godMode to check whether or not the player has bought godMode.
      int getHealth()
      This method retrieves the player's current health level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getHealthCost()
      This method retrieves the current healthCost of a health upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getMagazine()
      This method retrieves the player's current magazine level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getMagazineCost()
      This method retrieves the current magazineCost of a magazine upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getMoney()
      This method retrieves the player's current money to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getVision()
      This method retrieves the player's current vision level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
      int getVisionCost()
      This method retrieves the current visionCost of a vision upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • money

        private int money
        This field represents the money the player currently has. This field can be reduced when items are bought through the methods, buyHealth(), buyMagazine(), buyVision(), and buyGodMode(), and increased when achievements are obtained through the method, addMoney(int).

      • vision

        private int vision
        This field represents the player's current night vision goggles's level. This field dictates how far the player can see using the Map.look(edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.UI.direction, int) method.

      • magazine

        private int magazine
        This field represents the player's current magazine level. This field dictates the amount of ammo the player can hold and is used to set the player's max ammo using the Map.setMaxAmmo(int) method.

      • health

        private int health
        This field represents the player's current health level. This field dictates how much health the player gets when moving onto the next level and is used in the Map.nextLevel(int) method.

      • visionCost

        private int visionCost
        This field represents how much the vision upgrade currently costs. Every time an upgrade is bought the price is increased in the method, buyVision(). Once the highest upgrade is bought, this field will be set to 0.

      • magazineCost

        private int magazineCost
        This field represents how much the magazine upgrade currently costs. Every time an upgrade is bought the price is increased in the method, buyMagazine(). Once the highest upgrade is bought, this field will be set to 0.

      • healthCost

        private int healthCost
        This field represents how much the health upgrade currently costs. Every time an upgrade is bought the price is increased in the method, buyHealth(). Once the highest upgrade is bought, this field will be set to 0.

      • godMode

        private boolean godMode
        This field represents whether or not the player has obtained God mode or not. When God mode is obtained, the player can play in this new game mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        public Shop()
        This constructor method sets the player's money to 0, each upgrade to level 1, each upgrade cost to 100, and godMode to false.

    • Method Detail

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(int money)
        This method adds money based on the achievement that's been obtained. Different achievements will give different amounts of money, which will be passed as an integer parameter to this method from the GameEngine.
        Parameters:
        money - the amount of money to be given to the player

      • buyVision

        public void buyVision()
        This method "buys" one vision upgrade, which increases the vision upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current visionCost, and changes the visionCost accordingly.

      • buyMagazine

        public void buyMagazine()
        This method "buys" one magazine upgrade, which increases the magazine upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current magazineCost, and changes the magazineCost accordingly.

      • buyHealth

        public void buyHealth()
        This method "buys" one health upgrade, which increases the health upgrade level, decreases the player's money based on the current healthCost, and changes the healthCost accordingly.

      • buyGodMode

        public void buyGodMode()
        This method "buys" God mode, which sets godMode to true and decreases the player's money by 4000.

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()
        This method retrieves the player's current money to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the player's current money

      • getVision

        public int getVision()
        This method retrieves the player's current vision level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the player's current vision level

      • getMagazine

        public int getMagazine()
        This method retrieves the player's current magazine level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the player's current magazine level

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        This method retrieves the player's current health level to be used in the game logic as well as in the method, UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the player's current health level

      • getVisionCost

        public int getVisionCost()
        This method retrieves the current visionCost of a vision upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the current cost of a vision upgrade

      • getMagazineCost

        public int getMagazineCost()
        This method retrieves the current magazineCost of a magazine upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the current cost of a magazine upgrade

      • getHealthCost

        public int getHealthCost()
        This method retrieves the current healthCost of a health upgrade to be used in the method UI.printShop(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        the current cost of a health upgrade

      • getGodMode

        public boolean getGodMode()
        This method retrieves the boolean value of godMode to check whether or not the player has bought godMode. If godMode is bought, then the game mode option will be available once the player starts a new game.
        Returns:
        true if godMode has been bought, false otherwise
